thread.title: Football: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte: These are the teams that can win Premier League title
thread.title_full: Football: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte: These are the teams that can win Premier League title

title: Football: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte: These are the teams that can win Premier League title
text:
By Mirror Monday, February 13th 2017 at 00:00 
Antonio Conte insists the title race is not over - despite seeing Chelsea extend their lead to 10 points. 
Conte claims six teams are still in the mix for the Premier League and challenged his players to keep fighting for every point. 
“If someone thinks the league is finished, I can tell you now, no,” said the Chelsea boss. 
“There are six teams for me that could win the league. Anything can happen until the end. We must continue to work in this way, to fight, to try to win in the same way we tried today.” 
Conte was unhappy with the result, even though Burnley had won seven of their previous eight home games. ALSO READ: Leicester slump 'unbelievable' after 2-0 loss at Swansea City, says Ranieri 
“I’m disappointed because our mentality, it must be that we have to try always to win,” said the Italian. 
“We did this today. But sometimes you must understand that there are tough games, and this game was very tough. 
“I’m pleased because we tried to win. I’m disappointed for the points, not for commitment, work-rate, will to fight, will to win. 
“I’m disappointed because I like to win. I always like to take three points and my players are like this.” 
Conte also praised Thibaut Courtois for making two fine stops after Robbie Brady had cancelled out Pedro’s opener and claimed his side stood up well to Burnley’s long-ball tactics. 
“For sure, our goalkeeper stays there to make a save sometimes,” he said. 
“Today we tried to play football. We tried to create situations. We found a team that tried to disrupt our football, to play these long-balls and to fight for the second balls. 
“I have great respect for every type of football. I don’t like to judge the other.”
